title: Sample Chicken Curry
description: This Filipino-style chicken curry is a hearty and flavorful dish made with tender chicken pieces simmered in a rich coconut milk-based sauce infused with curry spices. It’s balanced with soft vegetables like potatoes and carrots, and finished with colorful bell peppers. Perfect for serving with steamed rice, it’s a comforting and savory meal loved by the whole family.
name: Mark
ingredients:
• 1kg chicken pieces
• 2 potatoes, cubed
• 1 carrot, sliced
• 1 bell pepper, sliced
• 1 can coconut milk
• 2 tbsp curry powder
• 3 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 onion, chopped
• Salt and pepper to taste
instructions:
1. Sauté garlic and onion.
2. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
3. Stir in curry powder and cook for 2 minutes.
4. Add coconut milk, potatoes, and carrots.
5. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
6. Add bell pepper and season with salt and pepper.
7. Simmer for 5 more minutes.
8. Serve hot with rice.

title: Classic Pork Adobo
description: Pork Adobo is a classic Filipino dish known for its deep, savory flavor and comforting aroma. Pork belly is slowly simmered in a mixture of soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and bay leaves, resulting in a tender and flavorful dish. It’s a staple in every Filipino household, often served with hot white rice and perfect for leftovers that taste even better the next day.
name: Maria
ingredients:
• 1kg pork belly
• 1/2 cup soy sauce
• 1/2 cup vinegar
• 1 head garlic, crushed
• 1 tsp peppercorns
• 3 bay leaves
• Water as needed
instructions:
1. Combine pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, peppercorns, and bay leaves in a pot.
2. Simmer for 45 minutes to an hour.
3. Add water if needed.
4. Reduce sauce to desired consistency.
5. Serve with steamed rice.

title: Beef Mechado
description: Beef Mechado is a traditional Filipino beef stew braised in tomato sauce with a medley of vegetables. The dish gets its name from the Spanish word 'mechar,' meaning to stuff, referring to the larding of beef with pork fat in earlier versions. Today, it's known for its comforting richness, tangy sauce, and melt-in-your-mouth beef. It’s perfect for weekend meals and special occasions.
name: Juan
ingredients:
• 1kg beef chunks
• 1 can tomato sauce
• 2 potatoes, cubed
• 1 red bell pepper
• 1 onion
• 3 cloves garlic
• Soy sauce and calamansi juice
instructions:
1. Marinate beef in soy sauce and calamansi.
2. Sauté garlic and onion.
3. Add beef and sear.
4. Add tomato sauce and simmer until tender.
5. Add potatoes and bell pepper.
6. Cook until vegetables are soft.

title: Sinigang na Baboy
description: Sinigang na Baboy is a popular Filipino soup that highlights the use of a souring agent, typically tamarind, to create its signature tangy flavor. This dish combines pork ribs, fresh vegetables, and a savory broth to warm you up on a rainy day. It’s one of the most iconic comfort foods in Filipino cuisine and is often served with steamed rice for a truly satisfying meal.
name: Liza
ingredients:
• 1kg pork ribs
• 1 packet sinigang mix
• 2 tomatoes
• 1 onion
• Radish, kangkong, sitaw
• Eggplant and okra
instructions:
1. Boil pork until tender.
2. Add tomatoes and onion.
3. Add vegetables.
4. Add sinigang mix and simmer.
5. Serve hot.

title: Chicken Tinola
description: Chicken Tinola is a simple and healthy Filipino soup dish made with chicken, green papaya, and chili leaves simmered in a flavorful ginger broth. It’s a nourishing and light meal that’s perfect for anyone recovering from illness or seeking comfort. The warm broth and tender chicken are soothing and satisfying, often enjoyed with a side of rice for a full meal.
name: Carlos
ingredients:
• 1 whole chicken, chopped
• 1 green papaya, sliced
• 1 thumb ginger, sliced
• 2 cloves garlic
• 1 onion
• Chili leaves or malunggay
instructions:
1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
2. Add chicken and cook until white.
3. Add water and simmer.
4. Add papaya and cook until soft.
5. Add chili leaves.
6. Serve hot.
